New Records: Rilee Rossouw became the first Proteas man to score a century in the men's T20 World Cup.
Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw set a tournament record with a 163-run partnership for the second wicket.
South Africa achieved their second-largest T20I win in terms of runs.
Key Match Events: Rilee Rossouw scored 109 off 56 balls, including seven fours and eight sixes.
Quinton de Kock contributed 63 runs in the record partnership.
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 10 runs, including three powerplay wickets.
Tabraiz Shamsi took 3 wickets for 20 runs.
Shakib al Hasan was dismissed to a ball pitching outside leg stump which he failed to review.
Bangladesh was bowled out for 101, their biggest T20I defeat by runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Rain before play and early into the South Africa innings raised fears of a second washout in as many games for South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: A late cameo with the ball from Tabraiz Shamsi secured South Africa's second-largest T20I win in terms of runs, setting them up for vital clashes against India and Pakistan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play but did not result in a washout.
Mustafizur Rahman was the pick of the Bangladesh bowlers, finishing with 0 for 25.
